Tutorials.Item: Plane Finding
Bodylogical AR requires physical space to function. Move your device around a flat surface to let the camera scan for space. The scanned space will be highlighted in yellow.
Confirm Plane

Bodylogical AR requires physical space to function. Move your device around a flat surface to let the camera scan for space. The scanned space will be highlighted in yellow. When you have found an ideal surface, double tap the screen to place your stage.
Placing Stage
Move your device to adjust the position of the stage. Double tap to confirm its position.
Interaction
Touch an avatar to examine his/her stats. In general, click on AR objects, such as buttons, to interact.
Panel

The control panel contains options to progress through the app and modify the avatar. The settings panel contains general settings for the app. Inspect the lifestyle of the avatar. When you are ready, click "Next" to continue.
Activity
Use the left half of the panel to highlight a specific intervention. Click "Animate" to start the timing progress.
Progressing Time
Watch how the avatars are slowing down as they grow older. Click "Animate" again to pause the progress.
You can also drag the handle of the progress bar to jump to a specific time. Click "Reset" to go back to the present.
When you are done exploring, click "Next" to examine what caused these changes.
Prius
Check the panel on the right to inspect the details of the organs. Move your device closer to the avatar to see how Bodylogical works internally.
Internals
Each block represents an organ or a system. Watch how the biometrics are connected together and the data flow between different blocks.
When you are done exploring, click "Next" to check the actual data beneath this simulation.
Ribbon Chart
Each panel represents the avatar's health status in 5 year intervals. The metrics are connected with ribbons to reflect changes. Click on one specific biometric to study it closely.
The other panels have been moved to the right to reduce distraction. For more options, please click on the "Ribbons" panel.
Ribbons Panel

Use the left part to switch between different interventions. On the right part there are four tweaking options: "Show Ribbons" will toggle the ribbons on and off and would allow you to better inspect the numbers themselves.
Click the button again to restore the panel. "Transparent" will make the background transparent.
"Dim" will make the status bars dimmer so you can focus more on the ribbons.
"Hide bars" will hide the status bars, and gets rid of any distractions for the ribbons.
Now that you have a better idea of the avatar, you can click "Next" to loop through the three visualizations, or use the "Settings" panel to select a new avatar.
